de.cocolab.reuse.test
Class IdentDrv

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--java.lang.Thread
        |
        +--de.cocolab.reuse.test.IdentDrv
public class IdentDrv
extends java.lang.Thread

Test IdentTable and Ident.

When main is called with no arguments, identifiers are accepted interactively from standard input. This is the same as the test program in versions of the reuse package for other languages.

For a more rigorous test call main with arguments specifying test characteristics such as run time.

Field Detail

count

public int count
The number of identifier creations.

size

public int size
The number of identifiers to be used.

Because the identifiers are selected at random, it is not guaranteed that all identifiers will be created: the actual identifier table size may be less than this number.

Method Detail

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] argv)
                 throws java.lang.Throwable
Test IdentTable and Ident.

If no arguments are supplied, you are given two opportunities to enter identifiers, one to a line. When you enter "-" the identifier table is printed out.

With arguments, an automated test is run. A given number of identifiers is generated, and then a random selection of these are inserted into an identifier table. With appropriate arguments this means that the same identifier is likley to be entered more than once. A specified number of such tests are run in parallel on individual threads to verify thread safety.

The test data is produced with a specific seed so that the tests are repeatable except for timing issues related to threading.

Parameters:
argv[0] - count: the number of makeIdent calls to be executed
argv[1] - size: the number of indentifiers in the test set. Usually count will be much greater than size.
argv[2] - threads: how many parallel tests to carry out.

loop

public static void loop()
                 throws java.lang.Throwable
Interactive test.

Identifiers are read from standard input, terminated with a line containing a single hyphen.

run

public void run()
Thread definition.

Run an automated test according to suplied parameters (see count and size).

Overrides:
run in class java.lang.Thread

randomIdent

public void randomIdent(long seed,
                        int count,
                        int size)
                 throws java.lang.Throwable
Test IdentTable/Ident. Process: Invent size different strings. We actually just use numbers 1..size with a fudge to get strings of varying lengths. This scheme is simple and has the sort of regularity that may show up problems in hash chain logic that a more random selection might miss. Select count of these at random, and create identifier objects with them. Normally count >>> size. Use a hash table and arrays to check the results, i.e. that the same Ident is always returned for a given string.
